page.title: 14SCHOOL'S 125th ANNIVERSARY
page.content: On 19/7/85 Northleaze Primary School celebrated its 125th Anniversary. All the staff and children dressed in Victorian costume. The girls wore dark dresses and white aprons, and the boys short trousers. Their work was displayed in the Hall and in all the classrooms. The public were able to wander around seeing Victorian-style lessons in progress. Mrs Martin, Chairman of the School Governors was dressed as Lady Smyth, an important school benefactor, and came in a horse-drawn carriage. The classes all followed a Victorian curriculum, including drill and maypole dancing. The lunch was soup, salad, bread, cheese and gingerbread. Some children played recorders. Others did country dancing and singing. At the end of the day everyone sang the National Anthem. It was a day to remember!
